intro: Biscutella lucentina, commonly known as the golden biscuit flower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Biscutella lucentina is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecology.
